org.opensha2.data

Interface DataTable


  • public interface DataTable
    A 2-dimensional table of immutable, double-valued data that is arranged according to increasing and uniformly spaced double-valued keys. Data tables are almost always used to represent binned data, and so while row and column keys are bin centers, indexing is managed internally using bin edges. This simplifies issues related to rounding/precision errors that occur when indexing according to explicit double values.

    To create a DataTable instance, use a DataTable.Builder.

    Internally, a DataTable is backed by a double[][] array where 'row' refers to the 1st dimension and 'column' the 2nd.

    Note that data tables are not intended for use with very high precision data and keys are currently limited to a precision of 4 decimal places. This may be changed or improved in the future.

    Author:
    Peter Powers
    See Also:
    DataVolume
